attributes.action: Form cross party committee to agree strategy & funding of the NHS & care support
attributes.background: We need to agree a long term strategy for the NHS, to ensure we maximise our incredible resources and expertise. We have difficult choices to make: modernising to ensure we offer a consistent 7 day service; identify a way to fund the increasing demand; and how we fund elderly care in the community.
attributes.additional_details:
We have an increasingly ageing population with improved medical advances. The service needs to remove the administrative burdens and focus on efficient world class care, which will require moving to a manufacturing shift pattern impacting ALL staff, requiring cross party support. 
To maximise the use of hospital beds we need to review the control & funding of aftercare/nursing homes to ensure quality and remove the bottlenecks between the NHS and local authorities, changes to tax structure?

attributes.action: Give more mental health training to professionals - emergency services and A&E
attributes.background: I've had trips to A&E and other incidents with the police where I felt the staff weren't adequately trained and aware of mental health

attributes.action: GPs to be reviewed and retrained each time misdiagnosis of cancer
attributes.background: My son was misdiagnosed three times by GPs which lead to stage three. As they are the first point of call they need to spot this early and listen to parents. This happens too many times and no one is reviewed.
attributes.additional_details: I know of three cases, myself, two friends. All GPs incorrect medical knowledge of cancer.

attributes.action: Reduce the foreign aid budget for essential services in the UK
attributes.background: Elder care is lacking funding as is the NHS
attributes.additional_details:
The NHS is in dire straits this winter as is the NHS.
If foreign aid money to spurious projects was reduced, more money could be channeled into these vital services.

attributes.action: Compulsory cardiac screenings (once every 6 months) for those who do any sport.
attributes.background: Some people have have died whilst part taking in sports, such as Robin Chard aged 48 who died of cardiac arrest whilst cycling to raise money for a cancer charity.
attributes.additional_details: These are only a few examples listed, but if we had routine cardiac screenings these incidents would have been caught earlier and treatment would have been provided.

attributes.action: Reinstate pension age of 65 men 60 women for British citizens above 50 years old
attributes.background: Government greatly reduced the level of state pension paid with recent reform. This asks Government to reverse that decision for all people over the age of 50 years who have made a major contribution to their own state pension only to see it stolen away in the last years of their working lives.

attributes.action: Campaign for greater involvement of the UK in the refugee resettlement
attributes.background: The reason for this petition is because we believe that the UK isn't allowing the enough number of refugees into the UK. Also we should be allowed to be part of the decision of allowing refugees in or not because at the end of the day it is the public who put decision makers in power.
attributes.additional_details: As we have put the decision makers in power they need to understand that without us they wouldn't be in power and also the reason they are in power is so that our voice can be heard.

attributes.action: Ban cropping/clipping of a dog's ears
attributes.background: Ban the cropping/clipping of a dogs ears, unless it's for medical reasons. Most commonly seen in pit breeds, cropping a puppies ears purely for cosmetic reasons is mutilation. It's cruel and serves no purpose for their health. Only for the owners enjoyment.

attributes.action: Protect Whistleblowers in care sectors who are dismissed after whistle blowing
attributes.background: How many people working in any care sector have had to blow the whistle to find shortly after the procedure,they lose their job?I ask to protect whistleblowers after whistleblowing procedure.Future disciplinary hearings(or the like)to be held by different members of staff than the original procedure
attributes.additional_details: Whistleblowers need more protection than they get currently in the care sector. Too many people who choose to stand for the right thing and fight, lose their jobs in the end-these righteous people are the people we need working as doctors, nurses, support workers etc. There must be a change.

attributes.action: Start the process for UK to join the EURO monetary union
attributes.background:
Dismiss the outcome of the Brexit referendum recognising that was a mistake (clear example of why direct democracy does not work).
Give a strong signal to Europe and the World with the access of UK to the European monetary union.
attributes.additional_details: Show that UK knows that together we are stronger and that the fully developed union of the European people, more than the economic and monetary union, is the right path towards the future of UK, Europe and the World.

attributes.action: Nationalise Utility companies and regenerate UK infrastructure with the profits.
attributes.background: The privatised utility companies run a virtual monopoly with an arcane pricing structure designed to confuse. There was no evidence of significantly more inefficiency when they were previously in public ownership and unlike transport we all rely absolutely on utility companies for our wellbeing.
attributes.additional_details: I believe that given the option the majority of people in the UK would support a return to public ownership,  regardless of political persuasion. If necessary this might be an option for the larger metropolitan areas to run as pilot schemes initially , with a local poll conducted independently of any political party.

attributes.action: all road traffic accidents with police attendance should have a written report
attributes.background: 18 months ago I was knocked off my motorbike whilst filtering slow moving traffic by somebody who went to change lane without indicating, and with no police report and a witness who doesn't seem to want to give a statement I'm struggling to prove the events with my insurance company.
attributes.additional_details: The day after my accident I called the police and spoke to the attending officer who confirmed I was knocked off whilst filtering and the other driver had attempted to change lane without indicating. I also called the witness who confirmed that I was travelling in a safe manner and the other driver swerved to change lane without indicating and obviously being unaware of his surroundings and myself.

attributes.action: STOP Council Housing Benefit taking student loans into account as an income!
attributes.background: Currently if you are a university student and receive a maintenance loan the councils in UK include this as an income when evaluating a housing benefit claim! This is a loan to be paid back after graduation, not an income or bursary!

attributes.action: Make care for teenagers/young adults with disabilities free for working parents.
attributes.background: As a continually working parent of a child with a disability, it is impossible to find child care for my son either reasonably priced or even available. Unless I have a family member to look after my son outwith school hours I cannot work. Let's make this care available and free for working parents.

attributes.action:
Create non-geographical parliamentary 
constituencies for our Armed Forces.
attributes.background: Depending on individual circumstances, service personnel register to vote using an address which is either: their current address; one where they would reside but for their service, or a previous address. Thus personnel at any one location may be represented by MPs, from across the political divide.
attributes.additional_details:
Our Armed Forces deserve to elect their own MPs, rather than have them chosen by an electorate with little appreciation of service life and the conditions under which the military operate both here and abroad.
Without independent representation, or a formal federation, our Armed Forces are unable to make their views known in a coherent manner.  Non-geographical constituencies will enable service personnel to elect their own MPs, wherever they serve or live, and be seen as an identifiable entity.

attributes.action: We would like to get Creative Writing reinstated as an A- Level qualification
attributes.background: In 2018, the last exams of A-Level Creative Writing will run. This is  because the Department of Education and OFQUAL say that it doesn't meet their guidance and Nicky Morgan and Gove argue that it is not 'Academic' enough. We want to show them how academic it really is and show them why it matters.
attributes.additional_details: We want to argue against this. Michael Rosen said How about cutting art from art?. The government says that Creative Writing is too vocational yet they don't know how academic it really is.Otherwise why would it be offered at university? Furthermore, they want more 'academic' subjects such as English Literature to prove their worth but many teenagers find this difficult due to much writing being written in the elaborated code which puts children from a working class background at a disadvantage.

attributes.action: Ensure that visitors to the UK have medical insurance for their stay.
attributes.background: Medical attention given to overseas visitors (inc health tourism) is a drain on the NHS. The Border Agency should develop a method to ensure that visitors with visas also have appropriate medical insurance to cover them for their stay. The NHS could recover some of the £2B spent on overseas visitors
attributes.additional_details:
The combined cost of "deliberate health tourism" and unintentional visitor use of the NHS is estimated to be £2 billion per annum. No system is likely to be foolproof but every effort should be made to recover as much of that money as possible. Any recovered money should go directly to the relevant NHS trust.
Only 5% of that amount, £100 million, was recovered in 2013/14.

attributes.action: Introduce routine drug & alcohol testing to all adults working with children.
attributes.background:
Parents we need to take control of what our children are exposed to.
We are asking all parents to stand up for our children, sign our petition & insist that anyone working with under age children including school teachers must have compulsory routine drug & alcohol tests.

attributes.action: LOWER THE AGE OF FREE CHILD CARE FROM 3 TO 2 TO SUPPORT WORKING FAMILIES
attributes.background: In the UK, childcare is provided for working families at the age of 3 which means that from a young age, working families need to pay up to £40 a day for childcare. For full timers this equates to £800 per month. More than the average mortgage payment.
attributes.additional_details: For non working families childcare is provided for free of charge. This is a backwards system as why would someone who doesn't work need their child watched full time. Where as some one who is working has to pay for their child care and receives no support.

attributes.action: Open Drug Crisis Centres. stop death and crime with compassion and help.
attributes.background: It is a fact the war on drugs is not working. People are dying without help or a chance to get help.  Glasgow has just  opened its doors on a Drug crisis centre. It helps people to handle and control their substance abuse, offers help guidance and rehabilitation to those who would like to get better
attributes.additional_details: If you want to know more about how drug prohibition does not work. A good book is Chasing the Scream or Neil Woods, book Good cop, Bad war. It does not matter how much we spend trying to stop use of drugs it does not ease the problem it just makes it worse. Canada had a massive drug problem until they opened up safe centres for people to use and to get help. Portugal have stopped making drugs illegal and again the problems are being tackled, less death and crime. More Compassion4Progression

attributes.action: Ban the use of black plastic in single use packaging.
attributes.background: Many councils do not accept black plastic in recycling schemes because it is very difficult to recycle, and can contaminate the recycling process. We suggest that the use of black plastic in single use packaging is banned.

attributes.action: Regulate locksmithing in the UK
attributes.background: In the UK any one can trade as a locksmith. This means that the person you get to secure your property may not know the standards that are associated with the industry. It is time that this crucial trade is regulated to stop scam locksmiths from operating.
attributes.additional_details: At this time there are several trade associations operating in the UK.  We need to be clear on one operating body that can regulate, vet and ensure that those who trade in this sector are of a minimum standard. This would help to eliminate poor standards of craftsmanship and ensure better security throughout the Uk

attributes.action: Remove the 'triple lock' on pensions and invest billions saved into the NHS.
attributes.background: Average income for pensioners is now higher than for workers. The Work and Pensions Committee says the 'triple lock' (which cost an extra £6bn in 2015) is "unsustainable" and "more intergenerationally unfair" on younger families.
attributes.additional_details:
By targeting pensioner welfare at only those who need it we can save billions to fund our NHS.

1) The 'triple lock' guarantees that the state pension rises each year by the highest of either inflation, average earnings, or 2.5%.
2) The 'triple lock' cost an extra £6 billion in 2015 - Government Actuary's Department.
3) The average pensioner has a higher income than the average worker, after housing costs and dependants had been taken into account  - IFS, 2015.
4) The Work and Pensions Committee called the 'triple lock' "unsustainable" and "unfair" on younger families - November 2016.

attributes.action: Stop new Child Maintenence Service going by Gross income instead of Net income.
attributes.background: The new Child Maintenance Service is now going by gross income instead of fathers actual net pay.
attributes.additional_details: How can the new Child Maintenance Service justify going by gross income instead of net income? How can us fathers pay for our children with money that we do not even receive? I'm all for paying for our children but adding 20% charges on top if you use the collect and pay Service? Not all families have the luxury of their child's mother being co operative and will force you to use CMS. They don't even consider your monthly expenses such as mortgage etc. Please help and get the government to stop this ridiculous change before we all end up homeless and jobless.

attributes.action: Abolish Sunday trading for all High Street Retailers
attributes.background: We lost something valuable as a country when Sunday became a normal shopping day rather than a day for family, rest and relaxation. The freedom of some to shop on Sundays comes at the expense of those who have to work to serve them when they might want to spend time with their families

attributes.action: Consider a vote of No Confidence in Jeremy Hunt, Secretary of state for Health
attributes.background: The Independent exposes the collusion of Jeremy Hunt,  Department of Health and the HEE  to impose junior doctor contracts. Health Education England is meant to be an INDEPENDENT body  responsible for the teaching and training of health care staff. Mr Hunt cannot be trusted with future of our NHS.
attributes.additional_details:
6th January 2017 article in the Independent 
Emails show Jeremy Hunt’s Department of Health 'colluded' with ‘independent’ body to impose junior doctor contracts
Emails seen by The Independent reveal collaboration with Health Education England, which provides NHS trusts with £3.65bn of funding every year

attributes.action: Compulsory for UK schools to teach about sexual consent.
attributes.background: In the UK, it's not compulsory for schools to teach anything about sexual consent or healthy relationships, only about the biology of sex. Before teenagers are sexually active, consent education will give them the power to recognise when receiving or inflicting abuse/exploitation/rape.
attributes.additional_details: On average, the age of first intercourse experience is 15.6 years (14.9 for men and 15.9 for women). It seems, the majority of teenagers are sexually active before the legal age. It is for this reason, sexual consent must be taught before the age of 16. Not just our daughters should leave school able to navigate the sexual challenges and choices they’ll face in adulthood but more importantly boys. Schools must become educators and advocates of sex-positivity/healthy consent for both genders.

attributes.action: To allow free parking for up to three hours on all NHS hospital car parks.
attributes.background: The NHS state that they are making no profit from car parking charges, this cannot be correct when a Press Association report states that the NHS raised £120,000,000 (120 Million pounds sterling) from charges last year, up 5%.

attributes.action: Allow children access to more speech therapy on the NHS.
attributes.background: I want the NHS to offer more speech therapy on the NHS.  I have been fighting to get my son help for 2 years. We have to pay privately for someone to listen to us. We are seen weekly privately, but the NHS won't offer anywhere close to this. Our son has made so much progress having weekly sessions.

attributes.action: Men to be given automatic parental responsibility like women when a baby is due.
attributes.background: Woman have fought hard for their equal rights and they got it, which is just right, but when it comes to pregnancy men do not have the same rights as women and I aim to change that. I am a father to be and I have discovered that a father has to be registered on the birth certificate to have the....
attributes.additional_details: same rights as the mother to their new born child unless courts say otherwise. I want you to ask yourself something, what happens when both parents break up and the mother has a severe dislike to the father? lots of people act out of anger. The father has to pay thousands of pounds just to see his child a few days a week when he probably doesn't deserve that kinda treatment. people judge today by the actions of stupid men in the past but if we are all equal then why is the father the outcast?

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to deny estranged parents to be denied access to kids
attributes.background: It should be law that the estranged partner, be automatically allowed access to their children. If they truly pose a risk to them, the onus should be with the partner the children reside with to go to court prove why they feel it is not in the children's best interest to see the other parent.
attributes.additional_details: This mainly affects estranged Fathers, and now there is no legal aide for family matters, and the fact CSA take up to 40% of their wage for maintainence that they have to pay despite them being denied any kind of relationship with their children, a lot of Fathers can't afford to go to court. This is not equality!! If the children are young they can't express their needs, the law needs to ensure they do not suffer. We have enough childhood Depression. We need to put the children first.

attributes.action: Urge UN deployment of observers for safe evacuation of civilians and rebels
attributes.background: The Syrian Regime has failed to allow safe passage for besieged civilians and rebels to leave Aleppo and has resumed shelling. Thousands risk being massacred. The UK Government must support and urge the UN to deploy International Observers to facilitate the evacuation of all civilians and rebels.
attributes.additional_details:
As of the 14th of December 2016, France's Foreign Minister has called for the deployment of UN observers, but this has not been raised to the UN, nor does it stipulate safety for all civilians and militants. 

"What France demands is the presence of observers of the United Nations on the ground to have a guarantee that the evacuation, which is a priority for the civilians, [takes place], but also so that militants are not massacred," (Jean-Marc Ayrault - quoted by Les Echos newspaper).

attributes.action: Stop the spread of smart motorways
attributes.background: Stop the spread of the smart motorways throughout the country.They're clearly a money making scam an have done nothing but made the roads more dangerous.
attributes.additional_details: When they're on it's like driving through road works with no actual roadworks in place,because of too many motorist speeding up an slamming on aswel as making it more unsafe for anyone who has broken down.Changing the signs from 60,50,40,60,40 is clearly a way to catch people out an putting the 40 sign on at the bottom of a hill causes HGVs to use a lot more fuel to drag the load up the hill instead of maintaining speed.

attributes.action: Put the £369 million going into Buckingham Palace into the NHS.
attributes.background: I have been sat in the Children's A and E at the UHW for the past two hours. There are not enough seats, children sat on the floors and mother's with babies sat on baby chairs. There are not enough doctors on and it is evident the longer waiting times are distressing the children and young people.
attributes.additional_details:
During my girlfriends pregnancy, she had to wait 3 days to have her waters broken as there was not enough midwives to give the necessary supervision.

There was a mis-communication with medication due to staff being so busy they missed that she had already been administered. This could have led to an overdose. 

I have also just used the toilets at the UHW and attempted to wash my hands in three different cubicles. There is no soap in the dispensers and no running water in the sinks.

attributes.action: Make it law for companies to let applicants know if they have got a job or not.
attributes.background: When we apply for a job many of us find that we don't hear a thing back from the company concerned.  This has to stop, not only is it downright rude of a company/employer small or large to not tell people if they did not get a job.  I think it also has a negative affect on confidence.

attributes.action: Restrict noise of fireworks at organised displays to a maximum of 120 decibels
attributes.background: Fireworks sold to members of the public are subject to a restriction of 120 decibels. I ask that all fireworks are subject to this restriction as those used at displays are becoming rediculously load causing terror and suffering to animals and young children

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for companies to label their environmental impact on packaging
attributes.background: The same way we have warnings on packs of cigarettes, we need to inform consumers on the negative effects some of their purchase have on the planet. As a start, we request "Palm Oil Kills" warnings (text & picture) covering 13% of front & back of packaging for products using unsustainable palm oil.
attributes.additional_details: A large proportion of palm oil plantations are developed at the expense of biodiversity and ecosystems in the countries it is produced. Currently, a third of all mammal species in Indonesia are considered to be critically endangered as a consequence. Over 90% of orangutan habitat has been destroyed in the last 20 years and is considered “a conservation emergency” by the UN. An estimated 1000-5000 orangutans are killed each year for this development. More information can be found online.

attributes.action: Reduce the amount of tax charged on fuel
attributes.background: Far too much excise duty is placed on fuel leading in increased costs to the consumer

attributes.action: Investigate motor insurance policy pricing to ensure it is fair for everyone.
attributes.background: Motor insurance is a legal requirement and a social utility, but the transparency in policy pricing and post inception activities of insurers in recent years, is disadvantaging consumers and was not addressed in the Competitions and Markets Authority's investigate of 2013/14.
attributes.additional_details: The recent article from uSwitch.com, ( http://tinyurl.com/z2w83bh ), highlights that those seeking to save money by opting for third party only or third party fire and theft cover, are actually being charged more than for comprehensive cover. As motor insurance is a legal requirement, it is felt that insurance companies should be both transparent and accountable for their pricing structures, for such a economically vital, social utility as motor insurance, so that consumers are treated fairly.

attributes.action: Consider a second runway for Gatwick
attributes.background: Why allocate a 3rd runway to Heathrow when Gatwick will fund 2nd runway

attributes.action: Increase the bursary for training English teachers 2016-17
attributes.background:
The government are increasing the bursary for training English teachers from a minimum of £4,000 to £9,000 for all.
Many who are training to teach English this year will only receive £4,000 to cover living expenses. If they had applied this year they would receive over double the amount.
attributes.additional_details:
https://getintoteaching.education.gov.uk/funding-and-salary/overview

https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/561599/Initial_teacher_training_bursaries_funding_manual_2017_to_2018.pdf

attributes.action: Make diagnosed medical need the same as disability for discrimination laws
attributes.background: As someone suffering from diagnosed coeliac disease, I am appalled that there is no legislation which protects our rights (and those with other medically diagnosed conditions) from discrimination, unless that diagnosis happens to be recognised as a disability in law.
attributes.additional_details:
Whilst restaurants, cafes and other public bodies and places have to make reasonable adjustments for people with disability, there is no requirement for them to do likewise for a medically diagnosed condition, such as diabetes and coeliac disease.

Hospitals often fail to provide any gluten free menu options for coeliacs and despite NICE guidelines, the NHS trusts are withdrawing prescriptions for gluten free food, the only treatment for coeliacs (yet still prescribe food for other conditions).

attributes.action: Immediately stop and cancel IHAT investigations into British troops
attributes.background: There are investigations into British troops conduct in the Gulf area.  These were initiated by Gordon Brown.  Some investigations are still ongoing and pending, it is totally unfair to do this, our troops are the best in the World and should not be investigated in this way.

attributes.action: Not using signals correctly when driving should be a criminal offence
attributes.background: Introduce a fine for incorrect use of indicators at junctions and roundabouts.
attributes.additional_details: Incorrect use of signals cause unnecessary hold ups and leads to accidents

attributes.action: Review extra funding for m60 ring road and m56 and other adjoining motorways
attributes.background: Traffic chaos all around m60 ring road ever y day adding as much as 2 hours on to the journey , major problems Include m56 junctions 3 to 1 heading East to m60 anticlockwise at junction 3 cheadle
attributes.additional_details: M56 narrows to 2 lanes to join m60 4lanes to 2 causes bottleneck and traffic increasing up to 500,000 annually , nationally

attributes.action: Make patent infringement a criminal offence in the UK.
attributes.background: Patent infringement is commonplace. Personally and according to the Intellectual Property's Office's opinion I have experienced this directly.  However, as individual or small business trying to stop such trespass the cost is prohibitive as the penalties for unauthorised IPR's use is insufficient.
attributes.additional_details: Innovators who develop products look to protect such technology.  Enjoying rewards from inspiration made real are huge motivators. However, it is true to say, "patents are not worth the paper they are written on if not policed".  Unauthorised patent use is crushing for those who lack means. Business know this and take comfort at little or no penalty for their actions.  Our world is built on ideas, so why do we not protect the innovators? Steal the idea, steals the motivation and steals growth.

attributes.action: To have a 'No Bullying' Campaign/Policy in all educational sites across the UK.
attributes.background: During my time at school I had my fair share of bullying and was made to feel out of place. Speaking with local parents, who think schools don't do enough to prevent bullying, would like the government to set strict guidelines that must be followed in education for bullying, not set by the schools.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.gov.uk/bullying-at-school/the-law - says that policies are set by the school. If it was set by the government then all schools would be the same regarding the 'Behaviour Policy'. Schools could also teach that everyone is different have it be sexual orientation or religion, race which could prevent bullying. I will be campaigning to STOP THE BULLYING!! 

Questionnaire below:
https://www.surveymonkey.co.uk/r/LZNSF7K
Will be sent to schools and colleges around the UK for research.

attributes.action: Immediate management of Seagull numbers in South West England.
attributes.background: I live with my family in a seaside town called Budleigh Salterton, Devon and was recently attacked by a seagull while out with my newborn son who was in his pram at the time. The seagulls steal food, scare tourists, create mess and damage cars

attributes.action: Stop the Government sending £1.3 billion in foreign aid to China.
attributes.background: The Government plan to send £1.3 billion in foreign aid to help China's elderly is immoral when our own Social Care sector is failing. This money should be redirected into our own country.

attributes.action: Cap energy prices so that families do not struggle to keep there homes warm.
attributes.background: The Big Six energy firms are profiteering from ripping off British Customers. They should be held accountable for putting families such as those on benefits in to fuel poverty, especially when the winters are getting colder.
